content:
The advert you talk about typically appears the 'Message Pane are when you start up.

It does show the donate, but it also mentions what to do if you experience a crash or if you have a problem or question which some may say is useful stuff.

To disable it do this: Settings > General 'Thunderbird Start Page' uncheck this checkbox When Thunderbird launches, show the Start Page in the message area.'

content:
re :After closing the In Box,

The 'Inbox' is a folder in a mail account. It is shown the left Folder Pane.

I'm not sure what you mean by 'closing the Inbox' You just select the folder name to see it's contents.

re :The Tool Bar is not found in the Menu Bar either

Are you talking about the 'Menu Bar' toolbar or the Menu app icon ? The menu app icon has 3 lines If you want to enable the 'Menu Bar' toolbar - Click on 'Menu app icon' and select 'View' > 'Toolbars' and then select 'Menu Bar'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
The 'Quick Filter Bar' toolbar is identical to previous versions.

When you type into the 'Quick Filter' search, it auto starts looks for possible matches as you type according to whaterver filter you have enabled eg: Subject Body But those matches will only be in the selected folder.

Are you by any chance entering text and then clicking on the 'Return/Enter' key ? If yes, then that means use your current search data and auto apply to all folders and so invokes the 'Global Search'. It's a quick method to apply current search data to more than the selected folder without the need to reselect a different search and enter all the same search criteria again.

There is no need to press the Enter/Return key in order to start search in Quick Filter - it auto looks for anything as you type. Pressing the Enter/Return key means you want to expand the search to all folders - aka use a Global Search.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You need to make sure a few things are set up correctly in order to create a gmail account.

1. Firewall - Thunderbird must be listed/set up as an allowed program.

2. VPN Any VPN must be switched off otherwise gmail thinks you might be a hacker because of the attempt to hide your IP address.

3. localhost Some people maintain their own websites etc. If you use any programs that use the localhost such as Apache Xampp then you must switch them off whilst setting up Oauth token.

4. Access Webmail account via a browser If you have switched on 2 factor authentication then you need to make a decision. Either - switch it off so you can set up gmail account to use 'Authentication Method : Oauth2' OR - leave it switched on and create an app specific password. Then in Thunderbird use 'Authentication Method: Normal Password' for incoming and smtp server settings and when asked for password you enter the app specific password.

AS I'm not sure what type of account you want to create whilst in webmail account make sure you have enabled anything required. So if you want to use POP:

  • https://support.google.com/mail/answer/7104828?hl=en-GB


5. In Thunderbird you must allow cookies. So check the settings.

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Under 'Web content'
  • Select checkbox 'Accept cookies from sites'
  • Accept third party cookies 'Always'
  • Click on 'Exceptions...' button
  • Add the following and set it to 'Allow' : https://accounts.google.com
  • click on 'Save Changes'


6. To create a gmail account in Thunderbird:

  • Menu app icon > New Account > Email
  • Enter: Name, gmail email address, Password

That's the same password you use when you logon to webmail account BUT....Note: if you have switched on 2 factor authentication then it requires the app specific password instead of the normal one.

  • Select checkbox : 'Remember password'
  • Click on 'Continue'

By default Thunderbird will look for IMAP server settings and assume 2 factor authentication is switched off and therefore uses 'Authentication Method: Oauth2'.

Server Settings: IMAP

  • Server name: imap.gmail.com
  • Port: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Oauth2
  • Username: full gmail email address

SMTP

  • DEscription: full gmail email address
  • Server name: smtp.gmail.com
  • Port: 465
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Oauth2
  • Username: full gmail email address


So, if you want POP protocol AND/OR want to use gmail 2 factor authentication, then you have to modify the server settings - click on 'Configure Manually' button.

Select Protocol : POP

  • Server name: pop.gmail.com
  • Port: 995
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Oauth2
  • Username: full gmail email address

IF you want to use 2 factor authentication which uses an 'app specific password', then you must alter/edit the 'Authentication Method:' to use setting 'Normal Password'. This applies to Pop, Imap and SMTP Authentication Method.

Click on 'Re Test' or 'Done' as appropriate.

If set up to use 'Authentication MEthod' Oauth then you will get a prompt by google to logon using normal password and then another window to 'Allow' Thunderbird access to server.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You really need to offer information.

I'm presuming you are talking about some email you are expecting but don't receive.

You need to find out if that email was received onto your server email address. Logon to webmail account via a browser and check if you can see email.

Please note: If you have a Pop account in Thunderbird, then if server has put email into eg: spam then it cannot be downloaded - emails must be in the Inbox to get downloaded into a Pop account.

You would need to sort out why your account on server thought those emails to be spam. Maybe check some filters or set up address as ok.

If email does not arrive on server then that's a different problem - maybe the server is blocking it completely. Maybe you have used up your space allowance quota on server and so it cannot receive anything until you create some space on server. Check your useage. If necessary, delete a load of old emails off server. Please note - if you use an imap account then anything you delete off server will also get deleted from an imap account. So don;t delete important stuff or get a copy put into Thunderbird's Local Folders' account first.

Either way if email is not arriving on the server then there is nothing Thunderbird can do about it.
creator: Toad-Hall

content: - click menu icon in upper right. it's three short stacked bars. - from there, click 'account settings' - from there, highlight your account from left side. that should populate the right side stating IMAP or POP account
